snippet: The move, which follows a 2013 derailment, will be required for engineers and conductors with the two commuter railroads.
abstract: Gov Andrew Cuomo says conductors and engineers with Metropolitan Transportation Authority and Metro-North Railroad will be tested for sleep apnea following 2013 Metro-North derailment in Bronx that killed four people.
lead_paragraph: The move, which follows a 2013 derailment, will be required for engineers and conductors with the two commuter railroads.

headline.main: Cuomo Orders Sleep Apnea Tests for Metro-North and L.I.R.R. Workers
headline.print_headline: Sleep Testing Set for Rail Workers
